step_data.thought:
I can see that I've successfully edited the 'Maya Tunic' product by changing its Stock Status from 'Out of Stock' to 'In Stock', and I've saved these changes. The page even shows a success message: 'You saved the product.' This indicates that my edit was successful and the changes have been applied to the product.

Since the goal was to edit the details of the 'Maya Tunic' product, and I have successfully:
1. Found the product
2. Made a meaningful change (updated the Stock Status)
3. Saved the changes

I have completed the requested task. I should now inform the user that the product has been successfully edited.
step_data.action: stop('I have successfully edited the Maya Tunic product by changing its Stock Status from Out of Stock to In Stock. The changes have been saved.')
